alert.note: Alert for Blount; Loudon; Monroe; Morgan; Roane (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 20 at 12:39PM CDT until July 20 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Anderson, Blount, Knox, Loudon, Monroe, Morgan, Roane and Scott. * WHEN...Until 445 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 137 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen in the past hour across parts of the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are possible over the area over the next couple hours. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Knoxville, Oak Ridge, Maryville, Lenoir City, Alcoa, Kingston, Rockwood, Loudon, Wartburg, Farragut, Fairview, Oliver Springs, Louisville, Midtown, Harriman, Vonore, Greenback, Friendsville, Philadelphia and Oakdale. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
